repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
After the CPython change in https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/94050, it seems reasonable to try it.

Closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/2273

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9839,6 +9839,10 @@ def generate_result_code(self, code):
             flags.append('CO_VARARGS')
         if self.def_node.starstar_arg:
             flags.append('CO_VARKEYWORDS')
+        if self.def_node.is_generator and self.def_node.is_coroutine:
+            flags.append('CO_COROUTINE')
+            if self.def_node.is_asyncgen:
+                flags.append('CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR')

comment_data.body: it looks like `ns['foo']` isn't passing the duck-type check in inspect? I'm trying to debug this, how do I run just this one test case on my local machine?
comment_data.diff_hunk:

             await z
         await = 1
-        #self.assertTrue(inspect.iscoroutinefunction(f))
+        if sys.version_info > (3,10,5):
+            self.assertTrue(inspect.iscoroutinefunction(f))
 
 
 class TokenizerRegrTest(unittest.TestCase):

comment_data.body:
`python runtests.py test_coroutines_pep492` will run the file.

I don't think you can easily just run one testcase from the file though. I'd just delete the code you don't care about while you test it.

comment_data.body: This chain of conditions is actually correct in Cython. Not sure if it's always going to stay that way, though, so your suggestion might still have some future value.

comment_data.body: The condition is actually wrong. It should say `>= (3,10,6)`, because there's more stuff coming after the three digits.

comment_data.body:
it's not correct:

```pyx
# helloworld.pyx
async def hello():
    pass

async def hello_agen():
    yield
```

```python
# demo.py
import helloworld
import inspect


import asyncio
if inspect.iscoroutinefunction(helloworld.hello_agen):
    asyncio.run(helloworld.hello_agen())
```

results in:

```python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/graingert/projects/hello-coro/demo.py", line 7, in <module>
    asyncio.run(helloworld.hello_agen())
  File "/usr/lib/python3.11/asyncio/runners.py", line 187, in run
    return runner.run(main)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/lib/python3.11/asyncio/runners.py", line 89, in run
    raise ValueError("a coroutine was expected, got {!r}".format(coro))
ValueError: a coroutine was expected, got <async_generator object hello_agen at 0x7fbded6404a0>
sys:1: RuntimeWarning: coroutine 'hello_agen' was never awaited
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9839,6 +9839,10 @@ def generate_result_code(self, code):
             flags.append('CO_VARARGS')
         if self.def_node.starstar_arg:
             flags.append('CO_VARKEYWORDS')
+        if self.def_node.is_generator and self.def_node.is_coroutine:
+            flags.append('CO_COROUTINE')
+            if self.def_node.is_asyncgen:
+                flags.append('CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR')

@@ -9839,6 +9839,10 @@ def generate_result_code(self, code):
             flags.append('CO_VARARGS')
         if self.def_node.starstar_arg:
             flags.append('CO_VARKEYWORDS')
+        if self.def_node.is_generator and self.def_node.is_coroutine:
+            flags.append('CO_COROUTINE')
+            if self.def_node.is_asyncgen:
+                flags.append('CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR')

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
#ifndef CO_GENERATOR
  #define CO_GENERATOR 0x20
#endif
#ifndef CO_COROUTINE
  #define CO_COROUTINE 0x80
#endif
#ifndef CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR
  #define CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR 0x200
#endif
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -650,6 +650,13 @@ class __Pyx_FakeReference {
 #endif
 #define __Pyx_NoneAsNull(obj)  (__Pyx_Py_IsNone(obj) ? NULL : (obj))
 
+#ifndef CO_COROUTINE
+  #define CO_COROUTINE 0x80
+#endif
+#ifndef CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR
+  #define CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR 0x200
+#endif

comment_data.body: Ok, that seems better then. Thanks.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9839,6 +9839,10 @@ def generate_result_code(self, code):
             flags.append('CO_VARARGS')
         if self.def_node.starstar_arg:
             flags.append('CO_VARKEYWORDS')
+        if self.def_node.is_generator and self.def_node.is_coroutine:
+            flags.append('CO_COROUTINE')
+            if self.def_node.is_asyncgen:
+                flags.append('CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR')

comment_data.body:
I checked, this was already added in Python 2.2, when generators were introduced. No need to assume it could be undefined.
```suggestion
```

commit.message: Make Cython async functions set CO_COROUTINE and CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR code flags to mark them as (Python) coroutines.
Disable the test changes again in Py<=3.10.5 since inspect.iscoroutinefunction() still returns False there.

Add CO_GENERATOR flag definition if unavailable

Co-authored-by: Thomas Grainger <tagrain@gmail.com>

commit.message:
Make (async) generator / coroutine flags exclusive

Co-authored-by: Thomas Grainger <tagrain@gmail.com>

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Make Cython async functions set CO_COROUTINE and CO_ASYNC_GENERATOR code flags
